newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Exxon's Argentine unit Esso to open new refinery.
newsitem.headline: Exxon's Argentine unit Esso to open new refinery.

text.p: Exxon Corp's Argentine unit Esso SAPA will open a new refinery to improve the output and quality of oil products and enhance exports to Argentina's Mercosur partners, a top company official said Wednesday.
"The new plant will be inaugurated between April and May at the port of Campana," Esso's Public Affairs manager Tomas Hess told Reuters in a phone interview.
Campana, 50 miles (80 km) north of Buenos Aires, is a port on the Parana river, part of the Mercosur waterway. Mercosur is a customs union formed by Argentina, Brazil, Uruguay and Paraguay.
Hess said the new plant will have a hydrotreatment capacity of 1,100 cubic meters a day and will be devoted basically to produce unleaded gasoline.
The company, with an oil products domestic market share of around 18 percent, already has a hydrotreatment plant in Campana with a capacity of 1,600 cubic meters a day.

The new plant is part of an investment plan Esso launched in 1993 at a growing pace that reached about $100 million last year, a level it expects to hold through the end of the century, Hess said. It has invested $350 million so far.
It will be inaugurated together with a state-of-the-art computer controlled refining system.
Esso exports about $90 million of oil products a year, Hess said.
